snippet: The Herman Miller Collection, a selective portfolio of furniture for modern living first developed in 1948, is being revived.
abstract: Furniture manufacturer Herman Miller introduces a collection of timeless modernist objects made for both the home and office. Photo (S)
lead_paragraph: The furniture manufacturer Herman Miller is reviving a concept it first developed in 1948: a selective portfolio of furniture for modern living that it believes will stand the test of time, known as the Herman Miller Collection. ''That was the name that George Nelson, who was our director of design at the time, used,'' said Ben Watson, the company's executive creative director. ''It was a collection of objects made for both the home and office.''

headline.main: A Revival for a Modern Collection
